alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 4:25PM CDT until April 18 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected on the Nemadji River. * WHERE...The Nemadji River across Douglas county in northwest Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding on the Nemadji River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM CDT, The Nemadji River will continue to rise as snow melt runoff makes its way into the river. At the gage located at County Highway C, the river may approach a level of 25 feet Thursday into Friday. - At a level of 23.5 feet, the water level is near the bottom of the County Highway C Bridge. A large area of backwater also forms upstream of the bridge at this level. Debris jamming under the bridge is possible. At a level of 26 feet, water encroaches a house west of the Nemadji River on County Road C. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Locations along the Nemadji River in Douglas county. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
